criteria: Understanding of Health Habits: Demonstrates comprehension of various health habits and their impact on personal well-being.
Application of Knowledge: Actively applies learned health habits in personal life and decision-making.
Self-Assessment and Reflection: Demonstrates ability to assess personal health habits and reflect on areas for improvement.
Responsibility and Accountability: Takes responsibility for personal health choices and accepts accountability for the outcomes.
descriptions: Shows no understanding of health habits or their impact.
Demonstrates minimal understanding of basic health habits.
Identifies some health habits but struggles to explain their importance.
Explains several health habits and their relevance to personal health.
Demonstrates a thorough understanding of a wide range of health habits and their effects.
Exhibits comprehensive knowledge of health habits, explaining their physiological and psychological impacts with clarity.
Does not apply any learned health habits in personal life.
Rarely applies health habits, even when prompted.
Occasionally attempts to apply health habits but inconsistently.
Applies several health habits in daily routines.
Consistently applies health habits, adapting them to different situations.
Serves as a role model, consistently and effectively applying comprehensive health habits in all aspects of life.
Shows no ability to assess personal health habits.
Struggles to identify personal health habits that need improvement.
Identifies some areas for improvement but lacks a plan for change.
Reflects on personal health habits and identifies realistic areas for improvement.
Routinely assesses personal health habits, setting goals for improvement and tracking progress.
Conducts in-depth self-assessments, creating comprehensive plans for continuous improvement of health habits.
Avoids taking responsibility for personal health choices.
Blames external factors for poor health choices.
Acknowledges some responsibility but struggles with accountability.
Accepts responsibility for most personal health choices and their consequences.
Consistently takes responsibility for health choices, learning from both successes and setbacks.
Demonstrates exceptional responsibility and accountability, proactively managing health choices and their long-term impacts.
